analyzed: sna'i 'dus te reg pa ni zhi bar yid la bya'o //
translated: One should pay attention to the nose sense-sphere as calm.

translated: One should pay attention to the nose sense-sphere as void.

analyzed: sna'i 'dus te reg pa ni nad du yid la bya'o // sna'i 'dus te reg pa ni shu bar yid la bya'o //
translated: One should pay attention to the nose sense-sphere as a disease.🔽One should pay attention to the nose sense-sphere as a boil.

analyzed: sna'i 'dus te reg pa ni zug rngur yid la bya'o // sna'i 'dus te reg pa ni sdig par yid la bya'o //
translated: One should pay attention to the nose sense-sphere as a barb.🔽One should pay attention to the nose sense-sphere as a misfortune.

original: sna'i 'dus te reg pa ni na bar yid la bya'o //🔽sna'i 'dus te reg pa ni dgrar yid la bya'o //
analyzed: sna'i 'dus te reg pa ni na bar yid la bya'o // sna'i 'dus te reg pa ni dgrar yid la bya'o //
translated: One should pay attention to the nose sense-sphere as a calamity.🔽One should pay attention to the nose sense-sphere as a plague.

analyzed: sna'i 'dus te reg pa ni 'jigs pa'i chos can du yid la bya'o // sna'i 'dus te reg pa ni mi brtan par yid la bya'o // sna'i 'dus te reg pa ni 'jig par yid la bya'o // sna'i 'dus te reg pa ni 'jigs par yid la bya'o //
translated: One should pay attention to the nose sense-sphere as alien.🔽One should pay attention to the nose sense-sphere as disintegrating.🔽One should pay attention to the nose sense-sphere as a plague.

original: @384b sna'i 'dus te reg pa ni 'go ba'i nad du yid la bya'o //
analyzed: @384b sna'i 'dus te reg pa ni 'go ba'i nad du yid la bya'o //
translated: One should pay attention to the nose sense-sphere as a disease.

original: sna'i 'dus te reg pa ni stong pa nyid du yid la bya'o //
analyzed: sna'i 'dus te reg pa ni stong pa nyid du yid la bya'o //
translated: one should pay attention to the emptiness of the sense-­faculties,🔽one should pay attention to the emptiness of the sense-­objects,🔽one should pay attention to the emptiness of the sense-­consciousnesses,

original: sna'i 'dus te reg pa ni bdag gi med par yid la bya'o //🔽sna'i 'dus te reg pa ni yid brtan du mi rung bar yid la bya'o //
analyzed: sna'i 'dus te reg pa ni bdag gi med par yid la bya'o // sna'i 'dus te reg pa ni yid brtan du mi rung bar yid la bya'o //
translated: one should pay attention to the emptiness of the sense-­impression,🔽one should pay attention to the emptiness of the sense-­contact,🔽one should pay attention to the emptiness of the sensation,🔽one should pay attention to the emptiness of the craving,🔽one should pay attention to the emptiness of the pursuit,

original: sna'i 'dus te reg pa ni gnod par yid la bya'o //
analyzed: sna'i 'dus te reg pa ni gnod par yid la bya'o //
translated: one should pay attention to the emptiness of the grasping,🔽one should pay attention to the emptiness of the existence,

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang ldan pa'i sems bskyed pas /🔽de mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang ldan pa'i sems bskyed pas / de mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis /
translated: one should pay attention to the emptiness of birth,🔽one should pay attention to the emptiness of old age,🔽one should pay attention to the emptiness of death,🔽one should pay attention to the emptiness of sorrow,

original: lce'i 'dus te reg pa ni mi rtag par yid la bya'o //🔽lce'i 'dus te reg pa ni sdug bsngal bar yid la bya'o //
analyzed: lce'i 'dus te reg pa ni mi rtag par yid la bya'o // lce'i 'dus te reg pa ni sdug bsngal bar yid la bya'o //
translated: one should pay attention to the emptiness of lamentation,🔽one should pay attention to the emptiness of suffering,🔽one should pay attention to the emptiness of unhappiness,🔽one should pay attention to the emptiness of disturbance,

original: lce'i 'dus te reg pa ni bdag med par yid la bya'o //🔽lce'i 'dus te reg pa ni zhi bar yid la bya'o //
analyzed: lce'i 'dus te reg pa ni bdag med par yid la bya'o // lce'i 'dus te reg pa ni zhi bar yid la bya'o //
translated: one should pay attention to the emptiness of the aggregates,🔽one should pay attention to the emptiness of the elements,🔽one should pay attention to the emptiness of the sense-­fields,🔽one should pay attention to the emptiness of the four establishments of mindfulness,🔽one should pay attention to the emptiness of the four right efforts,

original: lce'i 'dus te reg pa ni dben par yid la bya'o //🔽lce'i 'dus te reg pa ni nad du yid la bya'o //
analyzed: lce'i 'dus te reg pa ni dben par yid la bya'o // lce'i 'dus te reg pa ni nad du yid la bya'o //
translated: one should pay attention to the emptiness of the four bases of magical power,🔽one should pay attention to the emptiness of the five faculties,

original: lce'i 'dus te reg pa ni shu bar yid la bya'o //
analyzed: lce'i 'dus te reg pa ni shu bar yid la bya'o //
translated: one should pay attention to the emptiness of the five powers,🔽one should pay attention to the emptiness of the seven factors of enlightenment,🔽one should pay attention to the emptiness of the noble eightfold path,🔽one should pay attention to the emptiness of the fruit of the stream-­winner,🔽one should pay attention to the emptiness of the fruit of the once-­returner,🔽one should pay attention to the emptiness of the fruit of the non-­returner,🔽one should pay attention to the emptiness of the fruit of the arhat,🔽one should pay attention to the emptiness of the pratyekabuddha’s awakening,🔽one should pay attention to the emptiness of the knowledge of all modes.

original: lce'i 'dus te reg pa ni zug rngur yid la bya'o //🔽lce'i 'dus te reg pa ni sdig par yid la bya'o //
analyzed: lce'i 'dus te reg pa ni zug rngur yid la bya'o // lce'i 'dus te reg pa ni sdig par yid la bya'o //
translated: One should pay attention to the contact of the tongue as a dart.🔽One should pay attention to the contact of the tongue as a crime.

original: lce'i 'dus te reg pa ni na bar yid la bya'o //
analyzed: lce'i 'dus te reg pa ni na bar yid la bya'o //
translated: One should pay attention to the contact of the tongue as a sickness.

original: lce'i 'dus te reg pa ni dgrar yid la bya'o //🔽lce'i 'dus te reg pa ni 'jig pa'i chos can du yid la bya'o //
analyzed: lce'i 'dus te reg pa ni dgrar yid la bya'o // lce'i 'dus te reg pa ni 'jig pa'i chos can du yid la bya'o //
translated: One should pay attention to the contact of the tongue as an enemy.🔽One should pay attention to the contact of the tongue as impermanent.

original: lce'i 'dus te reg pa ni mi brtan par yid la bya'o //🔽lce'i 'dus te reg pa ni 'jig par yid la bya'o //
analyzed: lce'i 'dus te reg pa ni mi brtan par yid la bya'o // lce'i 'dus te reg pa ni 'jig par yid la bya'o //
translated: One should pay attention to the contact of the tongue as not a refuge.🔽One should pay attention to the contact of the tongue as subject to destruction.

original: lce'i 'dus te reg pa ni 'jigs par yid la bya'o //
analyzed: lce'i 'dus te reg pa ni 'jigs par yid la bya'o //
translated: One should pay attention to the contact of the tongue as subject to change.

original: lce'i 'dus te reg pa ni 'go ba'i nad du yid @385a *//
analyzed: lce'i 'dus te reg pa ni 'go ba'i nad du yid @385a *//
translated: One should pay attention to the contact of the tongue as subject to loss.

original: la bya'o // lce'i 'dus te reg pa ni stong pa nyid du yid la bya'o //
analyzed: la bya'o // lce'i 'dus te reg pa ni stong pa nyid du yid la bya'o //
translated: One should pay attention to the contact of the tongue as empty.

original: lce'i 'dus te reg pa ni bdag gi med par yid la bya'o //🔽lce'i 'dus te reg pa ni yid brtan du mi rung bar yid la bya'o //
analyzed: lce'i 'dus te reg pa ni bdag gi med par yid la bya'o // lce'i 'dus te reg pa ni yid brtan du mi rung bar yid la bya'o //
translated: One should pay attention to the contact of the tongue as not a self.🔽One should pay attention to the contact of the tongue as not a soul.🔽One should pay attention to the contact of the tongue as having no core.

original: lce'i 'dus te reg pa ni gnod par yid la bya'o //
analyzed: lce'i 'dus te reg pa ni gnod par yid la bya'o //
translated: One should pay attention to the contact of the tongue as having no essence.

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang ldan pa'i sems bskyed pas /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang ldan pa'i sems bskyed pas /
translated: “He should not form mental constructs about the sensory element of the body,

original: de mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis /🔽lus kyi 'dus te reg pa ni mi brtag par yid la bya'o //
analyzed: de mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis / lus kyi 'dus te reg pa ni mi brtag par yid la bya'o //
translated: but attend to it as not arisen.

analyzed: lus kyi 'dus te reg pa ni sdug bsngal bar yid la bya'o //
translated: He should attend to the sensory element of the body as painful.

original: lus kyi 'dus te reg pa ni bdag med par yid la bya'o //🔽lus kyi 'dus te reg pa ni zhi bar yid la bya'o //
analyzed: lus kyi 'dus te reg pa ni bdag med par yid la bya'o // lus kyi 'dus te reg pa ni zhi bar yid la bya'o //
translated: He should attend to the sensory element of the body as without a self.🔽He should attend to the sensory element of the body as calm.

original: lus kyi 'dus te reg pa ni dben par yid la bya'o //
analyzed: lus kyi 'dus te reg pa ni dben par yid la bya'o //
translated: He should attend to the sensory element of the body as void.

original: lus kyi 'dus te reg pa ni nad du yid la bya'o //🔽lus kyi 'dus te reg pa ni shu bar yid la bya'o //
analyzed: lus kyi 'dus te reg pa ni nad du yid la bya'o // lus kyi 'dus te reg pa ni shu bar yid la bya'o //
translated: He should attend to the sensory element of the body as sick.🔽He should attend to the sensory element of the body as a boil.

original: lus kyi 'dus te reg pa ni zug rngur yid la bya'o //🔽lus kyi 'dus te reg pa ni sdig par yid la bya'o //🔽lus kyi 'dus te reg pa ni na bar yid la bya'o //
analyzed: lus kyi 'dus te reg pa ni zug rngur yid la bya'o // lus kyi 'dus te reg pa ni sdig par yid la bya'o // lus kyi 'dus te reg pa ni na bar yid la bya'o //
translated: He should attend to the sensory element of the body as a thorn.🔽He should attend to the sensory element of the body as a misfortune.🔽He should attend to the sensory element of the body as a calamity.

original: lus kyi 'dus te reg pa ni dgrar yid la bya'o //
analyzed: lus kyi 'dus te reg pa ni dgrar yid la bya'o //
translated: He should attend to the sensory element of the body as a disaster.

original: lus kyi 'dus te reg pa ni 'jig pa'i chos can du yid la bya'o //
analyzed: lus kyi 'dus te reg pa ni 'jig pa'i chos can du yid la bya'o //
translated: One should pay attention to the fact that the composite of contact through body is subject to destruction.

original: lus kyi 'dus te reg pa ni mi brtan par yid la bya'o //🔽lus kyi 'dus te reg pa ni 'jig par yid la bya'o //
analyzed: lus kyi 'dus te reg pa ni mi brtan par yid la bya'o // lus kyi 'dus te reg pa ni 'jig par yid la bya'o //
translated: One should pay attention to the fact that the composite of contact through body is unstable.🔽One should pay attention to the fact that the composite of contact through body is perishable.

original: lus kyi 'dus te reg pa ni 'jigs par yid la bya'o //
analyzed: lus kyi 'dus te reg pa ni 'jigs par yid la bya'o //
translated: One should pay attention to the fact that the composite of contact through body is a threat.

original: lus kyi 'dus te reg pa ni 'go ba'i nad du yid la bya'o //
analyzed: lus kyi 'dus te reg pa ni 'go ba'i nad du yid la bya'o //
translated: One should pay attention to the fact that the composite of contact through body is a disease.

original: lus kyi @385b 'dus te reg pa ni stong pa nyid du yid la bya'o //
analyzed: lus kyi @385b 'dus te reg pa ni stong pa nyid du yid la bya'o //

original: lus kyi 'dus te reg pa ni bdag gi med par yid la bya'o //
analyzed: lus kyi 'dus te reg pa ni bdag gi med par yid la bya'o //
translated: One should pay attention to the fact that the composite of contact through body is not a self.

original: lus kyi 'dus te reg pa ni yid brtan du mi rung bar yid la bya'o //
analyzed: lus kyi 'dus te reg pa ni yid brtan du mi rung bar yid la bya'o //
translated: One should pay attention to the fact that the composite of contact through body is not a support.

original: lus kyi 'dus te reg pa ni gnod par yid la bya'o //
analyzed: lus kyi 'dus te reg pa ni gnod par yid la bya'o //
translated: One should pay attention to the fact that the composite of contact through body is a plague.

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang ldan pa'i sems bskyed pas /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang ldan pa'i sems bskyed pas /
translated: With a thought that is a mental state connected with the knowledge of all aspects,

original: de mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis /
analyzed: de mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis /
translated: and with a method of non-apprehension,

analyzed: yid kyi 'dus te reg pa ni mi rtag par yid la bya'o //
translated: one should pay attention to the fact that the composite of contact through mind is impermanent.

analyzed: yid kyi 'dus te reg pa ni sdug bsngal bar yid la bya'o //
translated: One should pay attention to the fact that mind contact is suffering.

translated: One should pay attention to the fact that mind contact is ownerless.🔽One should pay attention to the fact that mind contact is a disease.

analyzed: yid kyi 'dus te reg pa ni nad du yid la bya'o // yid kyi 'dus te reg pa ni shu bar yid la bya'o //
translated: One should pay attention to the fact that mind contact is a boil.🔽One should pay attention to the fact that mind contact is an arrow.

translated: One should pay attention to the fact that mind contact is a disaster.🔽One should pay attention to the fact that mind contact is impermanent.🔽One should pay attention to the fact that mind contact is unstable.

original: yid kyi 'dus te reg pa na 'jig par yid la bya'o //
analyzed: yid kyi 'dus te reg pa na 'jig par yid la bya'o //
translated: One should pay attention to the fact that mind contact is perishable.

original: yid kyi 'dus te reg pa ni 'jigs par yid la bya'o //
analyzed: yid kyi 'dus te reg pa ni 'jigs par yid la bya'o //
translated: One should pay attention to the fact that contact through mental rapport is a source of fear.

original: yid kyi 'dus te reg pa ni 'go ba'i nad du yid la bya'o //
analyzed: yid kyi 'dus te reg pa ni 'go ba'i nad du yid la bya'o //
translated: One should pay attention to the fact that contact through mental rapport is a source of disease.

analyzed: yid kyi 'dus te reg pa ni stong pa nyid du yid la bya'o // yid kyi @386a *//

analyzed: 'dus te reg pa ni bdag gi med par yid la bya'o // yid kyi 'dus te reg pa ni yid brtan du mi rung bar yid la bya'o //
translated: One should pay attention to the fact that contact through mental rapport has no self.🔽One should pay attention to the fact that contact through mental rapport is unreliable.

original: yid kyi 'dus te reg pa ni gnod par yid la bya'o //
analyzed: yid kyi 'dus te reg pa ni gnod par yid la bya'o //
translated: One should pay attention to the fact that contact through mental rapport is subject to change.

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang ldan pa'i sems bskyed pas /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang ldan pa'i sems bskyed pas /
translated: With a thought that is connected with the knowledge of all modes,

original: de mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis /
analyzed: de mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis /

analyzed: mig gi 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba ni sdug bsngal bar yid la bya'o //

analyzed: mig gi 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba ni zhi bar yid la bya'o //

original: mig gi 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba ni dben par yid la bya'o //
analyzed: mig gi 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba ni dben par yid la bya'o //

analyzed: 'du byed 'gag pa ni zhi bar yid la bya'o //
translated: The cessation of volitional factors should be regarded as peace.

analyzed: 'du byed 'gag pa ni bden par yid la bya'o /

analyzed: 'du byed 'gag pa ni stong pa nyid du yid la bya'o // 'du byed 'gag pa ni mtshan ma med pa nyid du yid la bya'o // 'du byed 'gag pa ni smon pa med pa nyid du yid bya'o //
translated: The cessation of volitional factors should be regarded as empty.🔽The cessation of volitional factors should be regarded as signless.🔽The cessation of volitional factors should be regarded as wishless.

original: 'du byed 'gag pa ni mngon par 'du byed pa med pa nyid du yid la bya'o /
analyzed: 'du byed 'gag pa ni mngon par 'du byed pa med pa nyid du yid la bya'o /

analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang ldan pa'i sems bskyed pas //
translated: “The bodhisattvas’ development of the mind of awakening is connected with the knowledge of all aspects.

original: de mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis /
analyzed: de mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis /
translated: They should do this without apprehending anything.

original: 'du byed 'gags pas rnam par shes pa 'gag pa ni bdag med par yid la bya'o //
analyzed: 'du byed 'gags pas rnam par shes pa 'gag pa ni bdag med par yid la bya'o //
translated: The cessation of consciousness due to the cessation of volitional factors should be regarded as selfless.

original: rnam par shes pa 'gag pa ni zhi bar yid la bya'o //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa 'gag pa ni zhi bar yid la bya'o //
translated: The cessation of consciousness should be seen as peace.

original: rnam par shes pa 'gag pa ni dben par yid la bya'o //🔽rnam par shes pa 'gag pa ni stong pa nyid du yid la bya'o //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa 'gag pa ni dben par yid la bya'o // rnam par shes pa 'gag pa ni stong pa nyid du yid la bya'o //
translated: The cessation of consciousness should be seen as isolation.🔽The cessation of consciousness should be seen as empty.🔽The cessation of consciousness should be seen as signless.🔽The cessation of consciousness should be seen as wishless.🔽The cessation of consciousness should be seen as non-performance.🔽The cessation of consciousness should be seen as non-production.🔽The cessation of consciousness should be seen as an attribute of nirvāṇa.🔽The cessation of consciousness should be seen as the emptiness of inherent existence.🔽The cessation of consciousness should be seen as the emptiness of external existence.🔽The cessation of consciousness should be seen as the emptiness of both internal and external existence.

original: rnam par shes pa 'gag pa ni mtshan ma med pa nyid du yid la bya'o //🔽rnam par shes pa @397b 'gag med pa ni smon pa med pa nyid du yid la bya'o /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa 'gag pa ni mtshan ma med pa nyid du yid la bya'o // rnam par shes pa @397b 'gag med pa ni smon pa med pa nyid du yid la bya'o /
translated: The cessation of consciousness should be seen as the emptiness of emptiness.🔽The cessation of consciousness should be seen as the emptiness of ultimate reality.🔽The cessation of consciousness should be seen as the emptiness of conditioned phenomena.🔽The cessation of consciousness should be seen as the emptiness of unconditioned phenomena.🔽The cessation of consciousness should be seen as the emptiness of the unlimited.

original: rnam par shes pa 'gag pa ni mngon par 'du byed pa med pa nyid du yid la bya'o /🔽rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang ldan pa'i sems bskyed pas de mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis /🔽rnam par shes pa 'gags pas ming dang gzugs 'gag pa ni bdag med par yid la bya'o //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa 'gag pa ni mngon par 'du byed pa med pa nyid du yid la bya'o / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang ldan pa'i sems bskyed pas de mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis / rnam par shes pa 'gags pas ming dang gzugs 'gag pa ni bdag med par yid la bya'o //
translated: The cessation of consciousness should be seen as the emptiness of that which has neither been examined nor analyzed.🔽The cessation of consciousness should be seen as the emptiness of inherent existence.🔽The cessation of consciousness should be seen as the emptiness of external existence.🔽The cessation of consciousness should be seen as the emptiness of both internal and external existence.🔽The cessation of consciousness should be seen as the emptiness of emptiness.🔽The cessation of consciousness should be seen as the emptiness of ultimate reality.🔽The cessation of consciousness should be seen as the emptiness of conditioned phenomena.🔽The cessation of consciousness should be seen as the emptiness of unconditioned phenomena.🔽The cessation of consciousness should be seen as the emptiness of the unlimited.🔽The cessation of consciousness should be seen as the emptiness of that which has neither been examined nor analyzed.🔽The cessation of consciousness should be seen as the emptiness of inherent existence.

original: ming dang gzugs 'gag pa ni zhi bar yid la bya'o //
analyzed: ming dang gzugs 'gag pa ni zhi bar yid la bya'o //
translated: The cessation of consciousness should be seen as the emptiness of external existence.🔽The cessation of consciousness should be seen as the emptiness of both internal and external existence.🔽The cessation of consciousness should be seen as the emptiness of emptiness.🔽The cessation of consciousness should be seen as the emptiness of ultimate reality.🔽The cessation of consciousness should be seen as the emptiness of conditioned phenomena.🔽The cessation of consciousness should be seen as the emptiness of unconditioned phenomena.

original: ming dang gzugs 'gag pa ni dben par yid la bya'o /
analyzed: ming dang gzugs 'gag pa ni dben par yid la bya'o /
translated: The cessation of consciousness should be seen as the emptiness of the unlimited.🔽The cessation

original: ming dang gzugs 'gag pa ni stong pa nyid yid la bya'o //🔽ming dang gzugs 'gag pa ni mtshan ma med pa nyid du yid la bya'o //🔽ming dang gzugs 'gag pa ni smon pa med pa nyid yid la bya'o //
analyzed: ming dang gzugs 'gag pa ni stong pa nyid yid la bya'o // ming dang gzugs 'gag pa ni mtshan ma med pa nyid du yid la bya'o // ming dang gzugs 'gag pa ni smon pa med pa nyid yid la bya'o //
translated: The cessation of name-and-form is emptiness.🔽The cessation of name-and-form is signlessness.🔽The cessation of name-and-form is wishlessness.

original: ming dang gzugs 'gag pa ni mngon par 'du byed pa med pa nyid yid la bya'o /🔽rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang ldan pa'i sems bskyed pas /🔽de mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis /🔽ming dang gzugs 'gags pas skye mched drug 'gag pa ni bdag med par yid la bya'o //🔽skye mched drug 'gag pa ni zhi bar yid bya'o //
analyzed: ming dang gzugs 'gag pa ni mngon par 'du byed pa med pa nyid yid la bya'o / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang ldan pa'i sems bskyed pas / de mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis / ming dang gzugs 'gags pas skye mched drug 'gag pa ni bdag med par yid la bya'o // skye mched drug 'gag pa ni zhi bar yid bya'o //
translated: The cessation of name-and-form is non-performance.🔽“The cessation of name-and-form is non-production,” this is the perfection of wisdom of the bodhisattva, the great being.🔽“The cessation of name-and-form is non-apprehension,” this is the perfection of wisdom of the bodhisattva, the great being.

original: skye mched drug 'gag pa ni bden par yid la bya'o //🔽skye mched drug 'gag pa ni stong pa nyid du yid la bya'o //
analyzed: skye mched drug 'gag pa ni bden par yid la bya'o // skye mched drug 'gag pa ni stong pa nyid du yid la bya'o //
translated: “The cessation of name-and-form is non-existence,” this is the perfection of wisdom of the bodhisattva, the great being.🔽“The cessation of name-and-form is emptiness,” this is the perfection of wisdom of the bodhisattva, the great being.

original: skye mched drug 'gag pa ni mtshan ma med pa nyid du yid la bya'o //
analyzed: skye mched drug 'gag pa ni mtshan ma med pa nyid du yid la bya'o //
translated: “The cessation of name-and-form is signlessness,” this is the perfection of wisdom of the bodhisattva, the great being.🔽“The cessation of name-and-form is wishlessness,” this is the perfection of wisdom of the bodhisattva, the great being.

original: skye mched drug 'gag pa ni smon pa med nyid du yid la bya'o //
analyzed: skye mched drug 'gag pa ni smon pa med nyid du yid la bya'o //
translated: The cessation of the six sense-spheres should be attended to as wishlessness.

original: skye mched drug 'gag pa ni mngon par 'du byed pa med pa nyid du yid la bya'o //
analyzed: skye mched drug 'gag pa ni mngon par 'du byed pa med pa nyid du yid la bya'o //

analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang ldan pa'i sems bskyed pas /

original: de mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis /

original: skye ba 'gag pa ni zhi bar yid la bya'o //🔽skye ba 'gag pa ni dben par yid la bya'o //
analyzed: skye ba 'gag pa ni zhi bar yid la bya'o // skye ba 'gag pa ni dben par yid la bya'o //
translated: The cessation of birth should be seen as peace.🔽The cessation of birth should be seen as void.

original: skye ba 'gag pa ni stong pa nyid du yid la bya'o //
analyzed: skye ba 'gag pa ni stong pa nyid du yid la bya'o //
translated: The cessation of birth should be seen as empty.

original: skye ba 'gag pa ni mtshan ma med pa nyid du yid la bya'o //🔽skye ba 'gag pa ni smon pa med pa nyid du yid la bya'o //
analyzed: skye ba 'gag pa ni mtshan ma med pa nyid du yid la bya'o // skye ba 'gag pa ni smon pa med pa nyid du yid la bya'o //
translated: The cessation of birth should be seen as signless.🔽The cessation of birth should be seen as wishless.

original: skye ba 'gag pa ni mngon par 'du byed pa nyid du yid la bya'o /
analyzed: skye ba 'gag pa ni mngon par 'du byed pa nyid du yid la bya'o /
translated: The cessation of birth should be seen as having nothing to do with deeds.

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang ldan pa'i sems bskyed pas /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang ldan pa'i sems bskyed pas /
translated: With a thought that is connected with the knowledge of all aspects,

original: de mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis //
analyzed: de mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis //
translated: and with a thought that is not connected with the knowledge of all aspects,🔽the cessation of birth is the cessation of old age and death,

original: skye ba 'gags pas rga shi dang / mya ngan dang / smre sngags 'don pa dang / sdug bsngal pa dang // yid mi bde ba dang / 'khrug pa dang / sdug bsngal gyi phung po chen po 'di rnams 'gag pa ni bdag med par yid la bya'o //

translated: grief, lamentation, pain, sorrow, and despair, and it is the cessation of this great mass of nothing but suffering.

original: rga shi dang / mya ngan dang / smre sngags 'don pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang // yid mi bde ba dang / 'khrug pa dang / sdug bsngal gyi phung po chen po 'di rnams 'gag pa ni zhi bar yid la bya'o //🔽rga shi dang / mya ngan dang / smre sngags 'don pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / yid mi bde ba dang / 'khrug pa dang / sdug bsngal gyi phung po chen po 'di rnams 'gag pa ni dben par yid la bya'o //
analyzed: rga shi dang / mya ngan dang / smre sngags 'don pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang // yid mi bde ba dang / 'khrug pa dang / sdug bsngal gyi phung po chen po 'di rnams 'gag pa ni zhi bar yid la bya'o // rga shi dang / mya ngan dang / smre sngags 'don pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / yid mi bde ba dang / 'khrug pa dang / sdug bsngal gyi phung po chen po 'di rnams 'gag pa ni dben par yid la bya'o //
translated: One should attend to the cessation of old age and death, and of sorrow, lamentation, pain, unhappiness, and distress as peace.🔽One should attend to the cessation of old age and death, and of sorrow, lamentation, pain, unhappiness, and distress as isolation.

original: rga shi dang / mya ngan dang / smre sngags 'don pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang // yid mi bde ba dang / @399b 'khrug pa dang / sdug bsngal gyi phung po chen po 'di rnams 'gag pa ni stong pa nyid du yid la bya'o //

translated: One should attend to the cessation of old age and death, and of sorrow, lamentation, pain, unhappiness, and distress as emptiness.

original: rga shi dang / mya ngan dang / smre sngags 'don pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / yid mi bde ba dang / 'khrug pa dang / sdug bsngal gyi phung po chen po 'di rnams 'gag pa ni mtshan ma med pa nyid du yid la bya'o //🔽rga shi dang / mya ngan dang / smre sngags 'don pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / yid mi bde ba dang / 'khrug pa dang / sdug bsngal gyi phung po chen po 'di rnams 'gag pa ni smon pa med pa nyid du yid la bya'o //

translated: The cessation of old age and death, sorrow, lamentation, pain, unhappiness, and distress is to be known as having no mark.🔽The cessation of old age and death, sorrow, lamentation, pain, unhappiness, and distress is to be known as having no wish.

original: rga shi dang / mya ngan dang / smre sngags 'don pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / yid mi bde ba dang / 'khrug pa dang / sdug bsngal gyi phung po chen po 'di rnams 'gag pa ni mngon par 'du byed pa med pa nyid du yid la bya'o //

translated: The cessation of old age and death, sorrow, lamentation, pain, unhappiness, and distress is to be known as having no formation.

original: koo shi ka /

translated: Kauśika,

translated: “With a bodhisattva great being’s production of the thought that is conjoined with the knowledge of all aspects, they cultivate the eight liberations without apprehending anything.

translated: “With a bodhisattva great being’s production of the thought that is conjoined with the knowledge of all aspects, they cultivate the nine serial absorptions without apprehending anything.🔽“With a bodhisattva great being’s production of the thought that is conjoined with the knowledge of all aspects, they cultivate the ten totalities without apprehending anything.

original: ldan pa'i sems bskyed pas mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis rnam par thar pa'i sgo stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa bsgom mo //🔽rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang ldan pa'i sems bskyed pa'i sems bskyed pas mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis mngon par shes pa rnams bsgom mo //
analyzed: ldan pa'i sems bskyed pas mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis rnam par thar pa'i sgo stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa bsgom mo // rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang ldan pa'i sems bskyed pa'i sems bskyed pas mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis mngon par shes pa rnams bsgom mo //
translated: “With a bodhicitta associated with the knowledge of all aspects, they cultivate the emptiness gate of liberation, the signlessness gate of liberation, and the wishlessness gate of liberation, without apprehending anything.🔽“With a bodhicitta associated with the knowledge of all aspects, they cultivate the superknowledges, without apprehending anything.

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang ldan pa'i sems bskyed pas mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis ting nge 'dzin rnams bsgom mo //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang ldan pa'i sems bskyed pas mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis ting nge 'dzin rnams bsgom mo //
translated: “With a bodhicitta associated with the knowledge of all aspects, they cultivate the meditative stabilizations, without apprehending anything.

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang ldan pa'i sems bskyed pas mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis gzungs kyi sgo rnams bsgom mo //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang ldan pa'i sems bskyed pas mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis gzungs kyi sgo rnams bsgom mo //
translated: “With a bodhicitta associated with the knowledge of all aspects, they cultivate the dhāraṇī gateways, without apprehending anything.

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang ldan pa'i sems bskyed pas mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu bsgom mo //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang ldan pa'i sems bskyed pas mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu bsgom mo //
translated: “With a bodhicitta associated with the knowledge of all aspects, they cultivate the ten tathāgata powers, without apprehending anything.

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang ldan pa'i sems bskyed pas mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis mi 'jigs pa bzhi bsgom mo //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang ldan pa'i sems bskyed pas mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis mi 'jigs pa bzhi bsgom mo //
translated: with the generation of the thought endowed with the knowledge of all modes, one should cultivate the four confidences in the manner of not taking anything as a basis.

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang ldan pa'i sems bskyed pas mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi bsgom mo //🔽rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang ldan pa'i sems bskyed pas mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis byams pa chen po bsgom mo //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang ldan pa'i sems bskyed pas mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi bsgom mo // rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang ldan pa'i sems bskyed pas mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis byams pa chen po bsgom mo //
translated: with the generation of the thought endowed with the knowledge of all modes, one should cultivate the four analytical knowledges in the manner of not taking anything as a basis.🔽with the generation of the thought endowed with the knowledge of all modes, one should cultivate the great friendliness in the manner of not taking anything as a basis.

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang ldan pa'i sems bskyed pas mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis snying rje chen po bsgom mo //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang ldan pa'i sems bskyed pas mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis snying rje chen po bsgom mo //
translated: with the generation of the thought endowed with the knowledge of all modes, one should cultivate the great compassion in the manner of not taking anything as a basis.

original: rnam pa thams cad @402b mkhyen pa nyid dang ldan pa'i sems bskyed pas mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad bsgom mo //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad @402b mkhyen pa nyid dang ldan pa'i sems bskyed pas mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad bsgom mo //
translated: with the generation of the thought endowed with the knowledge of all modes, one should cultivate the eighteen special qualities of the Buddha in the manner of not taking anything as a basis.

original: koo shi ka /
analyzed: koo shi ka /
translated: Kausika,

original: gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
analyzed: gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
translated: Moreover, when bodhisattva great beings practice the perfection of wisdom,

original: 'di ltar so sor yang dag par slob ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar so sor yang dag par slob ste /
translated: they train in the following way:

original: 'di ltar chos rnams mngon par rlan par byed pa dang / yongs su rlan par byed pa dang / yongs su rdzogs par byed pa dang / yongs su rgyas par byed pa dang / yongs su dpyod par byed pa de dag ni chos kho nar zad de /
analyzed: 'di ltar chos rnams mngon par rlan par byed pa dang / yongs su rlan par byed pa dang / yongs su rdzogs par byed pa dang / yongs su rgyas par byed pa dang / yongs su dpyod par byed pa de dag ni chos kho nar zad de /
translated: ‘Those who moisten, fully moisten, fully perfect, fully expand, and fully analyze phenomena are nothing but phenomena.

original: de la bdag gam bdag gi med do //
analyzed: de la bdag gam bdag gi med do //
translated: There is no self or mine in that.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na; de ni 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po yongs su bsngo ba'i sems gang yin pa de'ang byang chub kyi sems dang 'grogs pa ma yin /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na; de ni 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po yongs su bsngo ba'i sems gang yin pa de'ang byang chub kyi sems dang 'grogs pa ma yin /
translated: And why is that? It is because the bodhisattva great beings’ mind of dedication is not accompanied by the mind of awakening,

original: byang chub kyi sems gang yin pa de'ang yongs su bsngo ba'i sems dang 'grogs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: byang chub kyi sems gang yin pa de'ang yongs su bsngo ba'i sems dang 'grogs pa ma yin te /
translated: and the mind of awakening is not accompanied by the mind of dedication.

original: koo shi ka /
analyzed: koo shi ka /
translated: Kauśika,

original: yongs su bsngo ba'i sems gang yin pa de ni byang chub sems la med cing mi dmigs na /
analyzed: yongs su bsngo ba'i sems gang yin pa de ni byang chub sems la med cing mi dmigs na /
translated: If the thought of dedicating is not the thought of enlightenment and is not apprehended,

original: byang chub sems gang yin pa de ni yongs su bsngo ba'i sems la med cing mi dmigs te /
analyzed: byang chub sems gang yin pa de ni yongs su bsngo ba'i sems la med cing mi dmigs te /
translated: and if the thought of enlightenment is not the thought of dedicating and is not apprehended,

original: koo shi ka /
analyzed: koo shi ka /
translated: Kauśika,

original: gang de ltar chos thams cad la'ang rab tu rtog la /
analyzed: gang de ltar chos thams cad la'ang rab tu rtog la /
translated: when one thus realizes all dharmas,

original: chos gang la'ang rnam par rgyu ba med pa 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
analyzed: chos gang la'ang rnam par rgyu ba med pa 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
translated: and does not move around among any dharmas, this is the perfection of wisdom of bodhisattva great beings.

original: de skad ces smras pa dang / lha'i dbang po brgya byin gyis /
analyzed: de skad ces smras pa dang / lha'i dbang po brgya byin gyis /
translated: When this had been said, Śatakratu, head of the gods,

original: gnas brtan rab 'byor la 'di @403a *//🔽skad ces smas so //
analyzed: gnas brtan rab 'byor la 'di @403a *// skad ces smas so //
translated: said to the elder Subhūti,

original: btsun pa rab 'byor /🔽ji ltar na yongs su bsngo ba'i sems byang chub kyi sems dang 'grogs pa ma yin /
analyzed: btsun pa rab 'byor / ji ltar na yongs su bsngo ba'i sems byang chub kyi sems dang 'grogs pa ma yin /
translated: “Venerable monk Subhūti,🔽how is it that the thought of dedicating is not accompanied by the thought of enlightenment?

original: ji ltar na byang chub kyi sems yongs su bsngo ba'i sems dang 'grogs pa ma yin /
analyzed: ji ltar na byang chub kyi sems yongs su bsngo ba'i sems dang 'grogs pa ma yin /
translated: How is it that the thought of enlightenment is not accompanied by the thought of dedicating?

original: ji ltar na yongs su bsngo ba'i sems byang chub kyi sems la med cing mi dmigs /
analyzed: ji ltar na yongs su bsngo ba'i sems byang chub kyi sems la med cing mi dmigs /
translated: How is the thought of dedicating to the thought of awakening not existent and not found?

original: ji ltar na byang chub kyi sems yongs su bsngo ba'i sems la med cing mi dmigs /
analyzed: ji ltar na byang chub kyi sems yongs su bsngo ba'i sems la med cing mi dmigs /
translated: How is the thought of awakening not existent and not found in the thought of dedicating?

original: rab 'byor gyis smras pa /
analyzed: rab 'byor gyis smras pa /
translated: Subhūti replied,

original: koo shi ka /
analyzed: koo shi ka /
translated: “Kauśika,

original: yongs su bsngo ba'i sems gang yin pa de ni sems ma yin /
analyzed: yongs su bsngo ba'i sems gang yin pa de ni sems ma yin /
translated: the thought of dedicating is not a thought.

original: byang chub kyi sems gang yin pa de'ang yongs su bsngo ba'i sems ma yin te /
analyzed: byang chub kyi sems gang yin pa de'ang yongs su bsngo ba'i sems ma yin te /
translated: The thought of awakening is not the thought of dedicating.

original: de ltar na sems ma yin pa gang yin pa de ni bsam gyis mi khyab pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar na sems ma yin pa gang yin pa de ni bsam gyis mi khyab pa'o //
translated: Thus, that which is not a thought is inconceivable.

original: bsam gyis mi khyab pa gang yin pa de ni sems ma yin pa ste /
analyzed: bsam gyis mi khyab pa gang yin pa de ni sems ma yin pa ste /
translated: That which is inconceivable is not a thought.

original: sems ma yin pa de ni sems ma yin par yongs su bsngo ba med /
analyzed: sems ma yin pa de ni sems ma yin par yongs su bsngo ba med /
translated: That which is not a thought does not dedicate that which is not a thought.

original: bsam gyis mi khyab pa'ang bsam gyis mi khyab par yongs su bsngo ba med de /
analyzed: bsam gyis mi khyab pa'ang bsam gyis mi khyab par yongs su bsngo ba med de /
translated: The inconceivable does not dedicate the inconceivable.

original: de ltar na sems ma yin pa gang yin pa de ni bsam gyis mi khyab pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar na sems ma yin pa gang yin pa de ni bsam gyis mi khyab pa'o //
translated: Thus, that which is not a thought is inconceivable.

original: bsam gyis mi khyab pa gang yin pa de ni sems ma yin pa ste /
analyzed: bsam gyis mi khyab pa gang yin pa de ni sems ma yin pa ste /
translated: What is inconceivable is not the mind.

original: koo shi ka /
analyzed: koo shi ka /
translated: Kauśika,

original: 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
translated: this is the perfection of wisdom of bodhisattva great beings.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis /
translated: Then the Lord

original: tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor la bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor la bka' stsal pa /
translated: said to the venerable Subhūti:

original: rab 'byor khyod de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams la @403b shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ston cing mos pa bskyed pa legs so //🔽legs so // rab 'byor /
analyzed: rab 'byor khyod de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams la @403b shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ston cing mos pa bskyed pa legs so // legs so // rab 'byor /
translated: “Subhūti, it is good that you teach the perfection of wisdom to bodhisattva great beings and generate enthusiasm for it.🔽Subhūti, it is good.

original: legs so // rab 'byor gyis gsol ba /
analyzed: legs so // rab 'byor gyis gsol ba /
translated: Subhūti said,

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Lord,

original: bdag gis ni bcom ldan 'das kyi bka' drin dran par bgyi ba ste /
analyzed: bdag gis ni bcom ldan 'das kyi bka' drin dran par bgyi ba ste /
translated: I remember the kindness of the Lord

original: bka' drin mi dran par mi bgyi'o //
analyzed: bka' drin mi dran par mi bgyi'o //
translated: and do not forget it.

original: de ni 'di ltar sngon gyi de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams bzhugs pa'i tshe /
analyzed: de ni 'di ltar sngon gyi de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams bzhugs pa'i tshe /
translated: Because in the past, when the tathāgatas, worthy ones, perfectly complete buddhas were present,

original: de'i tshe nyan thos de dag gis /
analyzed: de'i tshe nyan thos de dag gis /
translated: at that time those śrāvakas

original: de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas sngon byang chub sems dpar gyur pa'i tshe /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas sngon byang chub sems dpar gyur pa'i tshe /
translated: The Thus-Gone One, the Worthy One, the Perfect Buddha, when he was a bodhisattva in the past,

original: pha rol tu phyin pa drug la gdams pa dang / rjes su bstan par bgyis te /
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa drug la gdams pa dang / rjes su bstan par bgyis te /
translated: instructed and taught the six perfections.

original: dgyes pa dang / yang dag par bskul ba dang / legs par gzengs bstod pa dang / rab tu dgyes pa dang / bzhag pa dang / shin tu bstan par bgyis pas /
analyzed: dgyes pa dang / yang dag par bskul ba dang / legs par gzengs bstod pa dang / rab tu dgyes pa dang / bzhag pa dang / shin tu bstan par bgyis pas /
translated: He delighted in them, encouraged others to take them up, praised them, rejoiced in them, established others in them, and explained them well.

original: sngon byang chub sems dpar gyur pa'i tshe /
analyzed: sngon byang chub sems dpar gyur pa'i tshe /
translated: In the past, when he was a bodhisattva,

original: pha rol tu phyin pa drug la bslab par mdzad de /
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa drug la bslab par mdzad de /
translated: he trained in the six perfections.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas so //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas so //
translated: Blessed One, he fully awakened to unsurpassed, perfect buddhahood.

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,

original: de bzhin du bdag gis kyang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams pha rol tu phyin pa drug la gdams par bgyi'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du bdag gis kyang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams pha rol tu phyin pa drug la gdams par bgyi'o //
translated: in the same way, I too will instruct the bodhisattva great beings in the six perfections.

original: rjes su stan par bgyi'o //
analyzed: rjes su stan par bgyi'o //
translated: I will teach them.

original: dga' bar bgyi'o //
analyzed: dga' bar bgyi'o //
translated: I will gladden them.

original: yang dag par bskul bar bgyi'o //🔽legs par gzengs bstod par bgyi'o //
analyzed: yang dag par bskul bar bgyi'o // legs par gzengs bstod par bgyi'o //
translated: I will encourage them.🔽I will cheer them.🔽I will delight them.

original: rab tu dga' bar bgyi'o //🔽@404a *// dgod par bgyi'o //
analyzed: rab tu dga' bar bgyi'o // @404a *// dgod par bgyi'o //
translated: I will establish them.

original: shin tu brtan par bgyi'o //
analyzed: shin tu brtan par bgyi'o //
translated: I will make them firm.

original: bdag gis byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po pha rol tu phyin pa drug la de ltar gdams pa dang / rjes su bstan pa dang / dga' bar bgyis pa dang / yang dag par bskul ba dang / legs par gzengs bstod pa dang /
analyzed: bdag gis byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po pha rol tu phyin pa drug la de ltar gdams pa dang / rjes su bstan pa dang / dga' bar bgyis pa dang / yang dag par bskul ba dang / legs par gzengs bstod pa dang /
translated: I will instruct and teach the bodhisattva great beings in the six perfections in this way, and I will gladden, encourage, and cheer them, and I will establish and make them firm in the six perfections.

original: rab tu dga' bar bgyis pa dang / bkod pa dang / shin tu brtan pa dag kyang bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rab tu dga' bar bgyis pa dang / bkod pa dang / shin tu brtan pa dag kyang bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Those bodhisattva great beings who are instructed and taught in the six perfections in this way, and who are gladdened, encouraged, and cheered, and who are established and made firm in the six perfections, will fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.”

original: de nas tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis /
analyzed: de nas tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis /
translated: Then venerable Subhūti

original: lha'i dbang po brgya byin la 'di skad ces smras so //
analyzed: lha'i dbang po brgya byin la 'di skad ces smras so //
translated: said this to Śatakratu, head of the gods:

original: koo shi ka /
analyzed: koo shi ka /
translated: “Kauśika,

original: de'i phyir shin tu legs par nyon la yid la gzung zhig dang / ji ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas par bya ba dang / ji ltar mi gnas par bya ba bdag gis bshad do //
analyzed: de'i phyir shin tu legs par nyon la yid la gzung zhig dang / ji ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas par bya ba dang / ji ltar mi gnas par bya ba bdag gis bshad do //
translated: I will explain how bodhisattva mahāsattvas should abide in the perfection of wisdom, and how they should not abide.

original: koo shi ka /
analyzed: koo shi ka /
translated: Kauśika,

original: gzugs ni gzugs kyis stong ngo //🔽tshor ba ni tshor bas stong ngo //
analyzed: gzugs ni gzugs kyis stong ngo // tshor ba ni tshor bas stong ngo //
translated: form is empty of form.🔽Feeling is empty of feeling.

original: 'du shes ni 'du shes kyis stong ngo //
analyzed: 'du shes ni 'du shes kyis stong ngo //
translated: Perception is empty of perception.

original: 'du byed ni 'du byed kyis stong ngo //
analyzed: 'du byed ni 'du byed kyis stong ngo //
translated: Formations are empty of formations.

original: rnam par shes pa ni rnam par shes pas stong ngo //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa ni rnam par shes pas stong ngo //
translated: Consciousness is empty of consciousness.

original: byang chub sems dpa' ni byang chub sems dpas stong ngo //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' ni byang chub sems dpas stong ngo //
translated: A bodhisattva is empty of a bodhisattva.

original: koo shi ka /
analyzed: koo shi ka /
translated: Kauśika,

original: de ltar na gzugs stong pa nyid dang / tshor ba stong pa nyid dang / 'du shes stong pa nyid dang / 'du byed stong pa nyid dang / rnam par shes pa stong pa nyid dang / byang chub sems dpa' stong @404b pa nyid de la gnyis su med cing gnyis su byar med do //
analyzed: de ltar na gzugs stong pa nyid dang / tshor ba stong pa nyid dang / 'du shes stong pa nyid dang / 'du byed stong pa nyid dang / rnam par shes pa stong pa nyid dang / byang chub sems dpa' stong @404b pa nyid de la gnyis su med cing gnyis su byar med do //
translated: Form is empty of form, feeling is empty of feeling, perception is empty of perception, volitional factors are empty of volitional factors, consciousness is empty of consciousness, and a bodhisattva is empty of a bodhisattva.

original: koo shi ka /
analyzed: koo shi ka /
translated: Kauśika,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la de ltar gnas par bya'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la de ltar gnas par bya'o //
translated: a bodhisattva great being should stand in the perfection of wisdom like that.”

original: koo shi ka gzhan yang mig ni mig gis stong ngo //
analyzed: koo shi ka gzhan yang mig ni mig gis stong ngo //
translated: “Furthermore, Kauśika, the eye is empty of the eye,

original: rna ba ni rna bas stong ngo //🔽sna ni snas stong ngo //
analyzed: rna ba ni rna bas stong ngo // sna ni snas stong ngo //
translated: the ear is empty of the ear,🔽the nose is empty of the nose,

original: lce ni lces stong ngo //
analyzed: lce ni lces stong ngo //
translated: the tongue is empty of the tongue,

original: lus ni lus kyis stong ngo //
analyzed: lus ni lus kyis stong ngo //
translated: the body is empty of the body,

original: yid ni yid kyis stong ngo //
analyzed: yid ni yid kyis stong ngo //
translated: and the thinking mind is empty of the thinking mind.

original: byang chub sems dpa' ni byang chub sems dpas stong ngo //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' ni byang chub sems dpas stong ngo //
translated: A bodhisattva is empty of a bodhisattva.

original: koo shi ka /
analyzed: koo shi ka /
translated: Kauśika,

original: de ltar na mig stong pa nyid dang / rna ba stong pa nyid dang / sna stong pa nyid dang / lce stong pa nyid dang / lus stong pa nyid dang / yid stong pa nyid dang / byang chub sems dpa' stong pa nyid de la gnyis su med cing gnyis su byar med do //🔽koo shi ka /
analyzed: de ltar na mig stong pa nyid dang / rna ba stong pa nyid dang / sna stong pa nyid dang / lce stong pa nyid dang / lus stong pa nyid dang / yid stong pa nyid dang / byang chub sems dpa' stong pa nyid de la gnyis su med cing gnyis su byar med do // koo shi ka /
translated: Thus, the emptiness of the eye, the emptiness of the ear, the emptiness of the nose, the emptiness of the tongue, the emptiness of the body, the emptiness of the mind, and the emptiness of the bodhisattva—these are not two, nor are they divided.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la de ltar gnas par bya'o //🔽koo shi ka /🔽gzhan yang gzugs ni gzugs kyis stong ngo //🔽sgra ni sgras stong ngo //🔽dri ni dris stong ngo //🔽ro ni ros stong ngo //🔽reg ni reg gis stong ngo //🔽chos ni chos kyis stong ngo //🔽byang chub sems dpa' ni byang chub sems dpas stong ngo //🔽koo shi ka /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la de ltar gnas par bya'o //🔽koo shi ka /🔽gzhan yang gzugs ni gzugs kyis stong ngo //🔽sgra ni sgras stong ngo //🔽dri ni dris stong ngo //🔽ro ni ros stong ngo //🔽reg ni reg gis stong ngo //🔽chos ni chos kyis stong ngo //🔽byang chub sems dpa' ni byang chub sems dpas stong ngo //🔽koo shi ka /
translated: Thus, the emptiness of the eye, the emptiness of the ear, the emptiness of the nose, the emptiness of the tongue, the emptiness of the body, the emptiness of the mind, and the emptiness of the bodhisattva—these are not two, nor are they divided.

original: de ltar na gzugs stong pa nyid dang / sgra stong pa nyid dang / dri stong pa nyid dang / ro stong pa nyid dang / reg stong pa nyid dang / chos stong pa nyid dang / byang chub sems dpa' stong pa nyid de la gnyis su med cing gnyis su byar med do //
analyzed: de ltar na gzugs stong pa nyid dang / sgra stong pa nyid dang / dri stong pa nyid dang / ro stong pa nyid dang / reg stong pa nyid dang / chos stong pa nyid dang / byang chub sems dpa' stong pa nyid de la gnyis su med cing gnyis su byar med do //
translated: Bodhisattvas are empty of bodhisattvas.

original: koo shi ka /🔽byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen @405a *//
analyzed: koo shi ka / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen @405a *//
translated: Kauśika,

original: pos shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la de ltar gnas par bya'o /
analyzed: pos shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la de ltar gnas par bya'o /
translated: bodhisattva great beings should train in the perfection of wisdom like that.

original: koo shi ka /
analyzed: koo shi ka /
translated: Kauśika,

original: gzhan yang mig gi rnam par shes pa ni mig gi rnam par shes pas stong ngo //🔽rna ba'i rnam par shes pa ni rna ba'i rnam par shes pas stong ngo //🔽sna'i rnam par shes pa ni sna'i rnam par shes pas stong ngo //
analyzed: gzhan yang mig gi rnam par shes pa ni mig gi rnam par shes pas stong ngo // rna ba'i rnam par shes pa ni rna ba'i rnam par shes pas stong ngo // sna'i rnam par shes pa ni sna'i rnam par shes pas stong ngo //
translated: further, eye consciousness is empty of eye consciousness,🔽ear consciousness is empty of ear consciousness,🔽nose consciousness is empty of nose consciousness,

original: lce'i rnam par shes pa ni lce'i rnam par shes pas stong ngo //
analyzed: lce'i rnam par shes pa ni lce'i rnam par shes pas stong ngo //
translated: tongue consciousness is empty of tongue consciousness,

original: lus kyi rnam par shes pa ni lus kyi rnam par shes pas stong ngo //
analyzed: lus kyi rnam par shes pa ni lus kyi rnam par shes pas stong ngo //
translated: the body consciousness is empty of the body consciousness,

original: yid kyi rnam par shes pa ni yid kyi rnam par shes pas stong ngo //
analyzed: yid kyi rnam par shes pa ni yid kyi rnam par shes pas stong ngo //
translated: the thinking-mind consciousness is empty of the thinking-mind consciousness,

original: byang chub sems dpa' ni byang chub sems dpas stong ngo //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' ni byang chub sems dpas stong ngo //
translated: and a bodhisattva is empty of a bodhisattva.

original: koo shi ka /
analyzed: koo shi ka /
translated: Kauśika,

original: de ltar na mig gi rnam par shes pa stong pa nyid dang / rna ba'i rnam par shes pa stong pa nyid dang / sna'i rnam par shes pa stong pa nyid dang / lce'i rnam par shes pa stong pa nyid dang / lus kyi rnam par shes pa stong pa nyid dang /
analyzed: de ltar na mig gi rnam par shes pa stong pa nyid dang / rna ba'i rnam par shes pa stong pa nyid dang / sna'i rnam par shes pa stong pa nyid dang / lce'i rnam par shes pa stong pa nyid dang / lus kyi rnam par shes pa stong pa nyid dang /
translated: in this way, the emptiness of the eye consciousness, the emptiness of the ear consciousness, the emptiness of the nose consciousness, the emptiness of the tongue consciousness, the emptiness of the body consciousness,

original: yid kyi rnam par shes pa stong pa nyid dang / byang chub sems dpa' stong pa nyid de la gnyis su med cing gnyis su byar med do //
analyzed: yid kyi rnam par shes pa stong pa nyid dang / byang chub sems dpa' stong pa nyid de la gnyis su med cing gnyis su byar med do //
translated: and the emptiness of the thinking-mind consciousness and the emptiness of a bodhisattva are not two, nor are they divided.

original: koo shi ka /
analyzed: koo shi ka /
translated: Kauśika,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa de ltar gnas par bya'o /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa de ltar gnas par bya'o /
translated: bodhisattva great beings should stand in the perfection of wisdom like that.”

original: koo shi ka /
analyzed: koo shi ka /
translated: Kauśika,

original: gzhan yang mig gi 'dus te reg pa ni mig gi 'dus te reg pas stong ngo //
analyzed: gzhan yang mig gi 'dus te reg pa ni mig gi 'dus te reg pas stong ngo //
translated: Furthermore, eye contact is empty of eye contact.

original: rna ba'i 'dus te reg pa ni rna ba'i 'dus te reg pas stong ngo //🔽sna'i 'dus te reg pa ni sna'i 'dus te reg pas stong ngo //
analyzed: rna ba'i 'dus te reg pa ni rna ba'i 'dus te reg pas stong ngo // sna'i 'dus te reg pa ni sna'i 'dus te reg pas stong ngo //
translated: Ear contact is empty of ear contact.🔽Nose contact is empty of nose contact.

original: lce'i @405b 'dus te reg pa ni lce'i 'dus te reg pas stong ngo //
analyzed: lce'i @405b 'dus te reg pa ni lce'i 'dus te reg pas stong ngo //
translated: Tongue contact is empty of tongue contact.

original: lus kyi 'dus te reg pa ni lus kyi 'dus te reg pas stong ngo //
analyzed: lus kyi 'dus te reg pa ni lus kyi 'dus te reg pas stong ngo //
translated: Body contact is empty of body contact.

original: yid kyi 'dus te reg pa ni yid kyi 'dus te reg pas stong ngo //
analyzed: yid kyi 'dus te reg pa ni yid kyi 'dus te reg pas stong ngo //
translated: Mind contact is empty of mind contact.

original: byang chub sems dpa' ni byang chub sems dpas stong ngo //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' ni byang chub sems dpas stong ngo //
translated: A bodhisattva is empty of a bodhisattva.

original: koo shi ka /
analyzed: koo shi ka /
translated: Kauśika,

original: de ltar na mig gi 'dus te reg pa stong pa nyid dang / rna ba'i 'dus te reg pa stong pa nyid dang / sna'i 'dus te reg pa stong pa nyid dang / lce'i 'dus te reg pa stong pa nyid dang / lus kyi 'dus te reg pa stong pa nyid dang /
analyzed: de ltar na mig gi 'dus te reg pa stong pa nyid dang / rna ba'i 'dus te reg pa stong pa nyid dang / sna'i 'dus te reg pa stong pa nyid dang / lce'i 'dus te reg pa stong pa nyid dang / lus kyi 'dus te reg pa stong pa nyid dang /
translated: thus, eye contact is emptiness, ear contact is emptiness, nose contact is emptiness, tongue contact is emptiness, body contact is emptiness,

original: yid kyi 'dus te reg pa stong pa nyid dang / byang chub sems dpa' stong pa nyid de la gnyis su med cing gnyis su byar med do //
analyzed: yid kyi 'dus te reg pa stong pa nyid dang / byang chub sems dpa' stong pa nyid de la gnyis su med cing gnyis su byar med do //
translated: The emptiness of the mind’s coming together with contact and the emptiness of a bodhisattva are not two and cannot be divided into two.🔽

original: koo shi ka /🔽byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la de ltar gnas par bya'o /
analyzed: koo shi ka / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la de ltar gnas par bya'o /
translated: The emptiness of the sensory element of the eyes is not the sensory element of the eyes, and similarly, the emptiness of the sensory element of sights is not the sensory element of sights, the emptiness of the sensory element of visual consciousness is not the sensory element of visual consciousness, the emptiness of the sensory element of the ears is not the sensory element of the ears, and similarly, the emptiness of the sensory element of sounds is not the sensory element of sounds, the emptiness of the sensory element of auditory consciousness is not the sensory element of auditory consciousness, the emptiness of the sensory element of the nose is not the sensory element of the nose, and similarly, the emptiness of the sensory element of smells is not the sensory element of smells, the emptiness of the sensory element of olfactory consciousness is not the sensory element of olfactory consciousness, the emptiness of the sensory element of the tongue is not the sensory element of the tongue, and similarly, the emptiness of the sensory element of tastes is not the sensory element of tastes, the emptiness of the sensory element of gustatory consciousness is not the sensory element of gustatory consciousness, the emptiness of the sensory element of the body is not the sensory element of the body, and similarly, the emptiness of the sensory element of tangibles is not the sensory element of tangibles, the emptiness of the sensory element of tactile consciousness is not the sensory element of tactile consciousness, the emptiness of the sensory element of the mental faculty is not the sensory element of the mental faculty, and similarly, the emptiness of the sensory element of mental phenomena is not the sensory element of mental phenomena, and the emptiness of the sensory element of mental consciousness is not the sensory element of mental consciousness.🔽Subhūti, this being the case, how can you say that ‘bodhisattva’ is the name of a real, truly existent entity?

original: koo shi ka /🔽gzhan yang mig gi 'dus te reg pa las byung ba'i tshor ba ni mig gi 'dus te reg pa las byung ba'i tshor bas stong ngo //
analyzed: koo shi ka / gzhan yang mig gi 'dus te reg pa las byung ba'i tshor ba ni mig gi 'dus te reg pa las byung ba'i tshor bas stong ngo //
translated: Subhūti, it is because of this that you should know that bodhisattvas are called ‘great beings.’🔽“Moreover, Subhūti, the sensory element of the eyes is empty of the sensory element of the eyes,

original: rna ba'i 'dus te reg pa las byung ba'i tshor ba ni rna ba'i 'dus te reg pa las byung ba'i tshor bas stong ngo //🔽sna'i 'dus te reg pa las byung ba'i tshor ba ni sna'i 'dus te reg pa las byung ba'i tshor bas stong ngo //🔽lce'i 'dus te reg pa las byung ba'i tshor ba ni lce'i 'dus te reg pa las byung ba'i tshor bas stong ngo //
analyzed: rna ba'i 'dus te reg pa las byung ba'i tshor ba ni rna ba'i 'dus te reg pa las byung ba'i tshor bas stong ngo //🔽sna'i 'dus te reg pa las byung ba'i tshor ba ni sna'i 'dus te reg pa las byung ba'i tshor bas stong ngo //🔽lce'i 'dus te reg pa las byung ba'i tshor ba ni lce'i 'dus te reg pa las byung ba'i tshor bas stong ngo //
translated: the sensory element of sights is empty of the sensory element of sights, the sensory element of visual consciousness is empty of the sensory element of visual consciousness, the sensory element of the ears is empty of the sensory element of the ears, the sensory element of sounds is empty of the sensory element of sounds, the sensory element of auditory consciousness is empty of the sensory element of auditory consciousness, the sensory element of the nose is empty of the sensory element of the

original: lus kyi 'dus te reg pa las byung ba'i tshor ba ni lus kyi 'dus te reg pa las byung ba'i tshor bas stong ngo //🔽yid kyi 'dus te @406a *//
analyzed: lus kyi 'dus te reg pa las byung ba'i tshor ba ni lus kyi 'dus te reg pa las byung ba'i tshor bas stong ngo // yid kyi 'dus te @406a *//
translated: The feeling that arises from the condition of sensory contact that is visually compounded is empty of the feeling that arises from the condition of sensory contact that is visually compounded.

original: reg pa las byung ba'i tshor ba ni yid kyi 'dus te reg pa las byung ba'i tshor bas stong ngo //
analyzed: reg pa las byung ba'i tshor ba ni yid kyi 'dus te reg pa las byung ba'i tshor bas stong ngo //
translated: The feeling that arises from the condition of sensory contact that is mentally compounded is empty of the feeling that arises from the condition of sensory contact that is mentally compounded.

original: byang chub sems dpa' ni byang chub sems dpas stong ngo //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' ni byang chub sems dpas stong ngo //
translated: A bodhisattva is empty of a bodhisattva.

original: koo shi ka /
analyzed: koo shi ka /
translated: Kauśika,

original: de ltar na mig gi 'dus te reg pa las byung ba'i tshor ba stong pa nyid dang / rna ba'i 'dus te reg pa las byung ba'i tshor ba stong pa nyid dang / sna'i 'dus te reg pa las byung ba'i tshor ba stong pa nyid dang /
analyzed: de ltar na mig gi 'dus te reg pa las byung ba'i tshor ba stong pa nyid dang / rna ba'i 'dus te reg pa las byung ba'i tshor ba stong pa nyid dang / sna'i 'dus te reg pa las byung ba'i tshor ba stong pa nyid dang /
translated: in this way, the emptiness of the feeling that arises from the condition of sensory contact that is visually compounded, the emptiness of the feeling that arises from the condition of sensory contact that is audibly compounded, the emptiness of the feeling that arises from the condition of sensory contact that is tangibly compounded,

original: lce'i 'dus te reg pa las byung ba'i tshor ba stong pa nyid dang / lus kyi 'dus te reg pa las byung ba'i tshor ba stong pa nyid dang / yid kyi 'dus te reg pa las byung ba'i tshor ba stong pa nyid dang / byang chub sems dpa' stong pa nyid de la gnyis su med cing gnyis su byar med do //🔽koo shi ka /
analyzed: lce'i 'dus te reg pa las byung ba'i tshor ba stong pa nyid dang / lus kyi 'dus te reg pa las byung ba'i tshor ba stong pa nyid dang / yid kyi 'dus te reg pa las byung ba'i tshor ba stong pa nyid dang / byang chub sems dpa' stong pa nyid de la gnyis su med cing gnyis su byar med do // koo shi ka /
translated: the emptiness of the feeling that arises from the contact of tongue and taste, the emptiness of the feeling that arises from the contact of body and touch, the emptiness of the feeling that arises from the contact of mind and dharmas, and the emptiness of a bodhisattva—in that emptiness there is no duality, and no non-duality.🔽Kauśika,🔽

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la de ltar gnas par bya'o //🔽koo shi ka /🔽gzhan yang sa'i khams ni sa'i khams kyis stong ngo //🔽chu'i khams ni chu'i khams kyis stong ngo //🔽me'i khams ni me'i khams kyis stong ngo //🔽rlung gi khams ni rlung gi khams kyis stong ngo //🔽nam mkha'i khams ni nam mkha'i khams kyis stong ngo //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la de ltar gnas par bya'o //🔽koo shi ka /🔽gzhan yang sa'i khams ni sa'i khams kyis stong ngo //🔽chu'i khams ni chu'i khams kyis stong ngo //🔽me'i khams ni me'i khams kyis stong ngo //🔽rlung gi khams ni rlung gi khams kyis stong ngo //🔽nam mkha'i khams ni nam mkha'i khams kyis stong ngo //
translated: the emptiness of the feeling that arises from the condition of the contact of the tongue and tastes, the emptiness of the feeling that arises from the condition of the contact of the body and touchables, and the emptiness of the feeling that arises from the condition of the contact of the mind and dharmas, and the emptiness of a bodhisattva—these are not two, nor are they divided.

original: rnam par shes pa'i khams ni rnam par shes pa'i khams kyis stong ngo //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i khams ni rnam par shes pa'i khams kyis stong ngo //
translated: the consciousness element is empty of the consciousness element.

original: byang chub sems dpa' ni byang chub sems dpas stong ngo //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' ni byang chub sems dpas stong ngo //
translated: A bodhisattva is empty of a bodhisattva.

original: koo shi ka /
analyzed: koo shi ka /
translated: Kauśika,

original: de ltar na sa'i khams stong pa nyid dang / chu'i khams stong pa nyid dang / @406b me'i khams stong pa nyid dang / rlung gi khams stong pa nyid dang / nam mkha'i khams stong pa nyid dang / rnam par shes pa'i khams stong pa nyid dang /
analyzed: de ltar na sa'i khams stong pa nyid dang / chu'i khams stong pa nyid dang / @406b me'i khams stong pa nyid dang / rlung gi khams stong pa nyid dang / nam mkha'i khams stong pa nyid dang / rnam par shes pa'i khams stong pa nyid dang /
translated: in this way, the emptiness of the earth element, the emptiness of the water element, the emptiness of the fire element, the emptiness of the wind element, the emptiness of the space element, the emptiness of the consciousness element,

original: byang chub sems dpa' stong pa nyid de la gnyis su med de gnyis su byar med do //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' stong pa nyid de la gnyis su med de gnyis su byar med do //
translated: and the emptiness of a bodhisattva—these are not two, nor are they divided.

original: koo shi ka /
analyzed: koo shi ka /
translated: Kauśika,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la de ltar gnas par bya'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la de ltar gnas par bya'o //
translated: a bodhisattva great being should stand in the perfection of wisdom like that.

original: koo shi ka /
analyzed: koo shi ka /
translated: Kauśika,

original: gzhan yang ma rig pa ni ma rig pas stong ngo //
analyzed: gzhan yang ma rig pa ni ma rig pas stong ngo //
translated: further, ignorance is empty of ignorance,

original: 'du byed ni 'du byed kyis stong ngo //
analyzed: 'du byed ni 'du byed kyis stong ngo //
translated: formations are empty of formations,

original: rnam par shes pa ni rnam par shes pas stong ngo //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa ni rnam par shes pas stong ngo //
translated: Consciousness is empty of consciousness.

original: ming dang gzugs ni ming dang gzugs kyis stong ngo //
analyzed: ming dang gzugs ni ming dang gzugs kyis stong ngo //
translated: Name and form are empty of name and form.

original: skye mched drug ni skye mched drug gis stong ngo //
analyzed: skye mched drug ni skye mched drug gis stong ngo //
translated: The six sense sources are empty of the six sense sources.

original: reg pa ni reg pas stong ngo //
analyzed: reg pa ni reg pas stong ngo //
translated: Contact is empty of contact.

original: tshor ba ni tshor bas stong ngo //🔽sred pa ni sred pas stong ngo //
analyzed: tshor ba ni tshor bas stong ngo // sred pa ni sred pas stong ngo //
translated: Sensation is empty of sensation.🔽Craving is empty of craving.

original: len pa ni len pas stong ngo //🔽srid pa ni srid pas stong ngo //
analyzed: len pa ni len pas stong ngo // srid pa ni srid pas stong ngo //
translated: Clinging is empty of clinging.🔽Becoming is empty of becoming.

original: skye ba ni skye bas stong ngo //
analyzed: skye ba ni skye bas stong ngo //
translated: Birth is empty of birth.

original: rga shi ni rga shis stong ngo //
analyzed: rga shi ni rga shis stong ngo //
translated: Aging and death are empty of aging and death.

original: byang chub sems dpa' ni byang chub sems dpas stong ngo //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' ni byang chub sems dpas stong ngo //
translated: A bodhisattva is empty of a bodhisattva.

original: koo shi ka /
analyzed: koo shi ka /
translated: Kauśika,

original: de ltar na ma rig pa stong pa nyid dang / 'du byed stong pa nyid dang / rnam par shes pa stong pa nyid dang / ming dang gzugs stong pa nyid dang / skye mched drug stong pa nyid dang / reg pa stong pa nyid dang /
analyzed: de ltar na ma rig pa stong pa nyid dang / 'du byed stong pa nyid dang / rnam par shes pa stong pa nyid dang / ming dang gzugs stong pa nyid dang / skye mched drug stong pa nyid dang / reg pa stong pa nyid dang /
translated: in this way, ignorance is emptiness, and emptiness is ignorance. Formations are emptiness, and emptiness is formations. Consciousness is emptiness, and emptiness is consciousness. Name and form are emptiness, and emptiness is name and form. The six sense sources are emptiness, and emptiness is the six sense sources. Contact is emptiness, and emptiness is contact.

original: tshor ba stong pa nyid dang / sred pa stong pa nyid dang / len pa stong pa nyid dang / srid pa stong pa nyid dang / skye ba stong pa nyid dang / rga shi stong pa nyid dang / byang chub sems dpa' stong pa nyid de la gnyis su med cing gnyis su byar med do //
analyzed: tshor ba stong pa nyid dang / sred pa stong pa nyid dang / len pa stong pa nyid dang / srid pa stong pa nyid dang / skye ba stong pa nyid dang / rga shi stong pa nyid dang / byang chub sems dpa' stong pa nyid de la gnyis su med cing gnyis su byar med do //
translated: the emptiness of feeling, the emptiness of craving, the emptiness of grasping, the emptiness of existence, the emptiness of birth, the emptiness of old age and death, and the emptiness of the bodhisattva—these are not two, nor are they divided.

original: koo shi ka /🔽byang chub @407a *//
analyzed: koo shi ka / byang chub @407a *//
translated: Kauśika,🔽the bodhisattva great being

original: sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la de ltar gnas par bya'o //
analyzed: sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la de ltar gnas par bya'o //
translated: should train in the perfection of wisdom like this.

original: koo shi ka /
analyzed: koo shi ka /
translated: Kauśika,

original: gzhan yang sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa ni sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pas stong ngo //
analyzed: gzhan yang sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa ni sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pas stong ngo //
translated: furthermore, the perfection of giving is empty of the perfection of giving,

original: tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pas stong ngo //
analyzed: tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pas stong ngo //
translated: the perfection of morality is empty of the perfection of morality,

original: bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa ni bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pas stong ngo //
analyzed: bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa ni bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pas stong ngo //
translated: the perfection of patience is empty of the perfection of patience,

original: brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pas stong ngo //
analyzed: brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pas stong ngo //
translated: The perfection of perseverance is empty of the perfection of perseverance.

original: bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pas stong ngo //
analyzed: bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pas stong ngo //
translated: The perfection of concentration is empty of the perfection of concentration.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pas stong ngo //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pas stong ngo //

original: byang chub sems dpa' ni byang chub sems dpas stong ngo //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' ni byang chub sems dpas stong ngo //
translated: A bodhisattva is empty of a bodhisattva.

original: koo shi ka /
analyzed: koo shi ka /
translated: Kauśika,

original: de ltar na sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa stong pa nyid dang / tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa stong pa nyid dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa stong pa nyid dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa stong pa nyid dang /
analyzed: de ltar na sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa stong pa nyid dang / tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa stong pa nyid dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa stong pa nyid dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa stong pa nyid dang /
translated: in this way, the emptiness of the perfection of generosity, the emptiness of the perfection of conduct, the emptiness of the perfection of patience, the emptiness of the perfection of perseverance,

analyzed: bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa stong pa nyid dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa stong pa nyid dang / byang chub sems dpa' stong pa nyid de la gnyis su med cing gnyis su byar med do //
translated: the emptiness of the perfection of meditative stabilization, the emptiness of the perfection of wisdom, and the emptiness of the bodhisattva are not two and are not divided.

original: koo shi ka /
analyzed: koo shi ka /
translated: Kauśika,

analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la de ltar gnas par bya'o //
translated: bodhisattva great beings should stand in the perfection of wisdom like that.

original: koo shi ka /
analyzed: koo shi ka /
translated: Kauśika,

analyzed: gzhan yang nang stong pa nyid ni nang stong pa nyid kyis @407b stong ngo //

original: phyi stong pa nyid ni phyi stong pa nyid kyis stong ngo //
analyzed: phyi stong pa nyid ni phyi stong pa nyid kyis stong ngo //
translated: the emptiness of external phenomena is empty of the emptiness of external phenomena,

original: phyi nang stong pa nyid ni phyi nang stong pa nyid kyis stong ngo //
analyzed: phyi nang stong pa nyid ni phyi nang stong pa nyid kyis stong ngo //
translated: the emptiness of external and internal phenomena is empty of the emptiness of external and internal phenomena,

original: stong pa nyid stong pa nyid ni stong pa nyid stong pa nyid kyis stong ngo //
analyzed: stong pa nyid stong pa nyid ni stong pa nyid stong pa nyid kyis stong ngo //
translated: the emptiness of emptiness is empty of the emptiness of emptiness,

original: chen po stong pa nyid ni chen po stong pa nyid kyis stong ngo //
analyzed: chen po stong pa nyid ni chen po stong pa nyid kyis stong ngo //
translated: the emptiness of great extent is empty of the emptiness of great extent,

original: don dam pa stong pa nyid ni don dam pa stong pa nyid kyis stong ngo //
analyzed: don dam pa stong pa nyid ni don dam pa stong pa nyid kyis stong ngo //
translated: The emptiness of the ultimate is empty of the emptiness of the ultimate.

original: 'dus byas stong pa nyid ni 'dus byas stong pa nyid kyis stong ngo //
analyzed: 'dus byas stong pa nyid ni 'dus byas stong pa nyid kyis stong ngo //
translated: The emptiness of the conditioned is empty of the emptiness of the conditioned.

original: 'dus ma byas stong pa nyid ni 'dus ma byas stong pa nyid kyis stong ngo //
analyzed: 'dus ma byas stong pa nyid ni 'dus ma byas stong pa nyid kyis stong ngo //
